definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Public health demands that milk and all milk products should be pure and wholesome.
sentences.chinese: 公共衛生要求乳品和所有乳製品應該是純淨衛生的。

sentences.english: The public health is a governmental vocation that faces the public.
sentences.chinese: 公共衛生行業是一個面向公衆的政府事業。

sentences.english: Public health experts observed antibiotic-resistant bacteria growing in these animals.
sentences.chinese: 公共衛生專家在這些牲畜中發現了抗生素耐藥細菌。

sentences.english: The public health significance of this finding is thus unclear.
sentences.chinese: 因而這一結論對公共衛生所具有的重要意義尚不清楚。

sentences.english: Fourth, we will steadily promote equal access for all to basic public health services.
sentences.chinese: 四是促進基本公共衛生服務逐步均等化。

sentences.english: For once, the ironic twists of history may turn in the favour of public health.
sentences.chinese: 這一次，歷史可能朝有利於公共衛生事業的方向演變。

sentences.english: Yet misdiagnosis of TB can be harmful both to patients and to public health.
sentences.chinese: 然而，結核病的誤診可能對病人和公共衛生都有害。

sentences.english: International agreements and accords are a necessary part of public health.
sentences.chinese: 國際協議和協定是公共衛生的一個必要部分。

sentences.english: He says malaria and dengue are among the greatest public health concerns.
sentences.chinese: 他說，瘧疾和登革熱是對公共衛生的最大威脅。

sentences.english: To understand the public sanitary situation of tea shops in Zhifu district.
sentences.chinese: 瞭解芝罘區茶館業公共衛生現狀。

sentences.english: Taeniasis is an important medical and economic problem in many countries in East Asia.
sentences.chinese: 絛蟲病在亞洲許多國家形成公共衛生及嚴重經濟問題。

sentences.english: That needs the ruthless discipline that good public health science demands.
sentences.chinese: 而這需要良好的公共衛生科學所要求的鐵的紀律。

sentences.english: What is a gender-based approach to public health?
sentences.chinese: 什麼是以性別爲基礎的公共衛生方針？

sentences.english: But public health has abundant experience on which to base its concern.
sentences.chinese: 但公共衛生擁有豐富的經驗可以作爲其關注的基礎。

sentences.english: Globally, falls are a major public health problem.
sentences.chinese: 在世界各地，跌傷是一重要公共衛生問題。

sentences.english: They are attacking the pillars of public health.
sentences.chinese: 這些影響在攻擊公共衛生的支柱。

definition: (political, economic etc) affairs/work/transaction (as in a computer database)
health bureau (or office, or department, or agency)
